alert.note: Alert for Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 5:12PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Salt Lake... southeastern Davis and east central Tooele Counties through 545 PM MDT... At 511 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Jordan, or 8 miles west of Sandy, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Salt Lake City, West Valley City, Sandy, Murray, West Jordan, Taylorsville, South Jordan, Draper, Riverton, Cottonwood Heights, Midvale, South Salt Lake, Herriman, North Salt Lake, Woods Cross, Bluffdale, West Bountiful, Millcreek, Kearns and Salt Lake City International Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 291 and 315. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 98 and 124. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Northern Wasatch Front; Salt Lake Valley; Tooele and Rush Valleys
